## Where in America is there Racially Polarized Voting? 

This is a resource designed to be used by voters, community groups, activists, and lawyers to aid in their development of campaigns to fully enfranchise voters of color in local government.  


```{r, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggiraph)
usa <- readRDS('usa_shp.rds') |> 
  mutate(link = paste0(STUSPS, '_2020'))
p <- usa %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_sf_interactive(aes(onclick = paste0('window.open("', link , '")')), 
                      fill = 'white', color = 'black') +
  geom_sf_text(aes(label = STUSPS), fun.geometry = \(x) geomander::st_circle_center(sf::st_as_sf(x))) +
  theme_void() +
  guides(fill = 'none') +
  theme(text = element_text(family = 'Arial', size = 1))


girafe(ggobj = p, 
       width_svg = 9, height_svg = 6,
       options = list(
         opts_hover(
           css = "cursor: pointer;
                  filter: drop-shadow(2px 2px 3px #0004);
                  fill: #CC7810;stroke:black;",
           reactive = TRUE),
         opts_tooltip(css="font-family: 'Arial'; 
                 background: #fffa; 
                 border-radius: 3px; 
                 padding: 0.3em;
                 backdrop-filter: blur(6px);",
                 delay_mouseover=100,
                 delay_mouseout=100),
         opts_toolbar(saveaspng=FALSE)
       )
)
```


Read more about the project [here](https://www.rpvnearme.org/about.html).

Download the [data](https://www.rpvnearme.org/data.html).
